actions.args: {"body": {"name": "Travel Stipends [REDACTED] hackathon - Bangkok, Nov. 24", "summary": "Hi guys,\\\\nI\\\\\\'m super happy to meet you again. Hacking at NEARCon last year in Lisbon was a great experience and I\\\\\\'m very excited to join in Bangkok.\\\\n\\\\nSince last time we met, I\\\\\\'ve been working full time on improving my solutions for a web3 sharing economy with Partage, and am currently building on a car-sharing system to allow users to rent cars owned by other users, in the most secure, decentralized and self-sovereign manner. ", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "I\\\\\\'m coming to the REDACTED hackathon in Bangkok and submit this proposal to try my chance to get part of my travel spendings covered. \\\\n\\\\nI\\\\\\'m [Julien Carbonnell](https://www.linkedin.com/in/juliencarbonnell/), a Blockchain and AI developer and scientist, with a background in smart-city and civic technologies. I\\\\\\'ve been investigating collaborative tech solutions for a while (2011) and fell in love with blockchain\\\\\\'s potential for solving data ownership and sovereignty.  \\\\n\\\\nI usually deliver a new prototype/MVP every 4-6 months and most of it is available on [my github profile](https://github.com/jcarbonnell) or [my huggingface profile](https://huggingface.co/jcarbonnell). Speaking of huggingface, I started earlier this year to train an open source code generation model on 3000 NEAR dApps repositories. It is called [NEARCoder](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b-cLcrGFBqI) and aims to integrate the upcoming NEAR AI platform. I believe NEARCoder got positive attention from the NEAR Builders ecosystem, as it was granted [400 NEAR by potlock](https://app.potlock.org/?tab=project&projectId=devbot.near&nav=funding). \\\\n\\\\nMy main project is called [Partage](https://partage.xyz). I\\\\\\'m a fan of p2p sharing systems, and am curently building a Web3 Car-Sharing solution. Very close to GetAround in terms of functionality, Partage Car-Sharing allows users to rent cars owned by other users, generating a passive income from low-risk investments on one side, and unlocking cars on-demand everywhere in the world on the other side. The reason why it should be on the blockchain is to improve the existing sharing economy services by leveraging the best features of blockchain technology: decentralization, data privacy, self-sovereignty, and a more equitable distribution of economic benefits. \\\\n\\\\nSo I built a working backend last week, plan to ensure a first partnership with a car brand next week, and will wrap it all in a friendly frontend by the submission deadline, October 25th. My goal in Bangkok is to pursue this project IRL, engage more hackers and partners, and keep growing an early adoption crowd around this project.\\\\n\\\\nI will be flying from Barcelona, Spain, where I reside currently, and will try to book the same accomodation in Bangkok as the most participating hackers I\\\\\\'m in touch with. \\\\n\\\\nYour support is very much appreciated.\\\\nSee you there!\\\\nJulien", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "partage.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 129296761}

{"data": {"events-committee.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *Bounty* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @95e55d367772049ae54a849b75fab957bab684640ddbd0ae51d94d348cd61d15\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Travel Stipends [REDACTED] hackathon - Bangkok, Nov. 24\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHi guys,\\\\\\\\nI\\\\\\'m super happy to meet you again. Hacking at NEARCon last year in Lisbon was a great experience and I\\\\\\'m very excited to join in Bangkok.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nSince last time we met, I\\\\\\'ve been working full time on improving my solutions for a web3 sharing economy with Partage, and am currently building on a car-sharing system to allow users to rent cars owned by other users, in the most secure, decentralized and self-sovereign manner. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=50)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 50, "snapshot": {"name": "Travel Stipends [REDACTED] hackathon - Bangkok, Nov. 24", "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "summary": "Hi guys,\\\\nI\\\\\\'m super happy to meet you again. Hacking at NEARCon last year in Lisbon was a great experience and I\\\\\\'m very excited to join in Bangkok.\\\\n\\\\nSince last time we met, I\\\\\\'ve been working full time on improving my solutions for a web3 sharing economy with Partage, and am currently building on a car-sharing system to allow users to rent cars owned by other users, in the most secure, decentralized and self-sovereign manner. ", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "95e55d367772049ae54a849b75fab957bab684640ddbd0ae51d94d348cd61d15", "timestamp": "1727766599147218331", "supervisor": null, "description": "I\\\\\\'m coming to the REDACTED hackathon in Bangkok and submit this proposal to try my chance to get part of my travel spendings covered. \\\\n\\\\nI\\\\\\'m [Julien Carbonnell](https://www.linkedin.com/in/juliencarbonnell/), a Blockchain and AI developer and scientist, with a background in smart-city and civic technologies. I\\\\\\'ve been investigating collaborative tech solutions for a while (2011) and fell in love with blockchain\\\\\\'s potential for solving data ownership and sovereignty.  \\\\n\\\\nI usually deliver a new prototype/MVP every 4-6 months and most of it is available on [my github profile](https://github.com/jcarbonnell) or [my huggingface profile](https://huggingface.co/jcarbonnell). Speaking of huggingface, I started earlier this year to train an open source code generation model on 3000 NEAR dApps repositories. It is called [NEARCoder](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b-cLcrGFBqI) and aims to integrate the upcoming NEAR AI platform. I believe NEARCoder got positive attention from the NEAR Builders ecosystem, as it was granted [400 NEAR by potlock](https://app.potlock.org/?tab=project&projectId=devbot.near&nav=funding). \\\\n\\\\nMy main project is called [Partage](https://partage.xyz). I\\\\\\'m a fan of p2p sharing systems, and am curently building a Web3 Car-Sharing solution. Very close to GetAround in terms of functionality, Partage Car-Sharing allows users to rent cars owned by other users, generating a passive income from low-risk investments on one side, and unlocking cars on-demand everywhere in the world on the other side. The reason why it should be on the blockchain is to improve the existing sharing economy services by leveraging the best features of blockchain technology: decentralization, data privacy, self-sovereignty, and a more equitable distribution of economic benefits. \\\\n\\\\nSo I built a working backend last week, plan to ensure a first partnership with a car brand next week, and will wrap it all in a friendly frontend by the submission deadline, October 25th. My goal in Bangkok is to pursue this project IRL, engage more hackers and partners, and keep growing an early adoption crowd around this project.\\\\n\\\\nI will be flying from Barcelona, Spain, where I reside currently, and will try to book the same accomodation in Bangkok as the most participating hackers I\\\\\\'m in touch with. \\\\n\\\\nYour support is very much appreciated.\\\\nSee you there!\\\\nJulien", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "partage.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "1000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "author_id": "95e55d367772049ae54a849b75fab957bab684640ddbd0ae51d94d348cd61d15", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"body": {"name": "Travel Stipend Proposal for Oskar - Hochiminh to Bangkok", "summary": "I am Oskar, an experienced NEAR hacker from Vietnam, applying for a travel stipend to attend the [REDACTED] event in Bangkok, Thailand. I plan to travel from Hochiminh City to Bangkok and participate in person, focusing on submitting an innovative project to meet the hackathon\\\\\\'s submission criteria.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "**Track Record:** I have a proven track record in NEAR and Ethereum hackathons. Here is my project submissions from NEAR Hackathon Project(s): https://devpost.com/software/nearlend\\\\n\\\\n**Travel Itinerary:**\\\\n*Departure:* 08 Nov 2024 from Hochiminh City\\\\n*Arrival:* 08 Nov 2024 in Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n*Return:* 14 Nov 2024\\\\n\\\\n**Attestation:** I will request an attestation from a NEAR DevHub core contributor to support my application.\\\\n\\\\n**Project Plan:** I am currently preparing a project that aligns with the goals of the [REDACTED] hackathon, which I will submit through Devpost. Once submitted, I will update this proposal with the URL to my project submission.\\\\n\\\\n**Conclusion: **I am eager to participate in the [REDACTED] hackathon and contribute my skills to the community. I kindly request a stipend of up to $500 to assist with my travel expenses from Vietnam to Thailand.\\\\n\\\\nThank you for considering my proposal.\\\\n\\\\nBest regards,\\\\nOskar Lee\\\\noskar_neld", "linked_proposals": [50], "receiver_account": "oskarlee.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "NEAR"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 129311248}

{"body": {"name": "Travel Stipend for participating in the IRL [REDACTED] Hackathon", "summary": "I am Lin, an experienced developer from Italy, I\\\\\\'m seeking a travel stipend to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok. With a proven track record in NEAR and ETHGlobal hackathons, I aim to contribute innovative projects to the NEAR ecosystem.", "category": "Bounty", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "Overseas Travel Stipend Application\\\\n\\\\nIm applying for the overseas travel stipend of up to 1000 to attend the [REDACTED] hackathon in Bangkok, Thailand. As a developer based in the north of Italy, this support is crucial for my participation.\\\\n\\\\nTrack Record\\\\n\\\\n- I built Near Journey, an interactive web-based learning platform to onboard near devs for NEAR MetaBUILD III Hackathon\\\\n  https://devpost.com/software/near-journey\\\\n\\\\n- friend.tech on BOS for encode Near Hackathon\\\\n  https://github.com/aeither/friendtech-on-bos\\\\n\\\\nTravel Details\\\\n\\\\nDeparture: Milan, Italy\\\\nDestination: Bangkok, Thailand\\\\n\\\\nEstimated Costs:\\\\n- Flight: 650\\\\n- Food: 120\\\\n- Local transportation: 80\\\\n- Total: 850\\\\n\\\\nTimeline and Commitments\\\\n\\\\n- Develop and submit an eligible project\\\\n- Update this proposal with Devpost submission URL\\\\n- Attend the IRL event in person\\\\n\\\\nFund Utilization\\\\n\\\\nThe stipend will directly cover travel expenses, ensuring my ability to attend and contribute to the hackathon. Any remaining funds will be used for accommodation or additional development resources.\\\\n\\\\nBenefits to NEAR Community\\\\n\\\\nMy participation will bring my years of perspective and expertise to the hackathon, fostering collaboration and innovative project development within the NEAR ecosystem. Im committed to knowledge sharing and networking, which will benefit both the local and global NEAR developer communities.\\\\n\\\\nIm excited about this opportunity to contribute to NEARs growth and look forward to the committees consideration.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "linext.near", "requested_sponsor": "events-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "850", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Travel expenses"], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 129347526}
